get.description:
Returns Encounters based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for Encounter.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Encounter.

parameters.name: _elements
parameters.description: Used to specify set of elements be returned as part of a resource. The _elements parameter consists of a comma separated list of base element names.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: Used to request the server to return a subset of the resource. It can contain one of the following values: true, false, text, data or count.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Used to search the entire content of the Encounter resource.

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Used to search on the narrative of the Encounter resource.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. Parameter values for _revinclude have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: appointment
parameters.description: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Reason the encounter takes place (resource).

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: A date within the period the Encounter lasted. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: A date within the period the Encounter lasted. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: episodeofcare
parameters.description: An episode of care that this encounter should be recorded against (EpisodeOfCare).

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: incomingreferral
parameters.description: Incoming Referral Request (ReferralRequest).

parameters.name: indication
parameters.description: Reason the encounter takes place (resource).

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Length of encounter in days.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location the encounter takes place (Location).

parameters.name: location-period
parameters.description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: location-period
parameters.description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: part-of
parameters.description: Another Encounter this encounter is part of (Encounter).

parameters.name: participant
parameters.description: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient (Practitioner, RelatedPerson).

parameters.name: participant-type
parameters.description: Role of participant in encounter. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient present at the encounter (Patient).

parameters.name: practitioner
parameters.description: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient (Practitioner).

parameters.name: procedure
parameters.description: The patient present at the encounter (Patient).

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Reason the encounter takes place (code). Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: special-arrangement
parameters.description: Wheelchair, translator, stretcher, etc. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: planned | arrived | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specific type of encounter. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: stateid
parameters.description: Unique id associated with a page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Encounter resource offset.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of Encounter resources requested in a page.

parameters.name: _pretty
parameters.description: Set true to get prettified data.

parameters.name: _bundletype
parameters.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle. Values can be one of: document | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection.

post.description:
This interaction searches a set of Encounters based on some filter criteria. Search interactions take a series of parameters of name'='value pairs encoded as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded submission for a POST.

parameters.description: Reason the encounter takes place (resource).

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Length of encounter in days.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location the encounter takes place (Location).

parameters.name: location-period
parameters.description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: location-period
parameters.description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: part-of
parameters.description: Another Encounter this encounter is part of (Encounter).

parameters.name: participant
parameters.description: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient (Practitioner, RelatedPerson).

parameters.name: participant-type
parameters.description: Role of participant in encounter. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient present at the encounter (Patient).

parameters.name: practitioner
parameters.description: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient (Practitioner).

parameters.name: procedure
parameters.description: The patient present at the encounter (Patient).

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Reason the encounter takes place (code). Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: special-arrangement
parameters.description: Wheelchair, translator, stretcher, etc. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: planned | arrived | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specific type of encounter. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

200.description: The set of resources associated with a particular encounter.

get.description:
Returns all the information related to a specific Encounter resource.

FHIR documentation for Encounter.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Encounter.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

200.description: List of all tags affixed to the nominated version of the resource.

outhB2C.description: Security scheme for B2C flow using authorization code flow.
